content.raw:
May I suggest using the first positional argument as the sdf file instead of `-f`, i.e `ign gazebo [options] FILE`. I think people that have used classic Gazebo expect this behavior and IMHO, having the input file as the positional argument is the most popular convention. 

If we choose not to go this route, at the very least, if users do `ign gazebo file.sdf`, we should print out a warning saying "did you mean ign gazebo -f file.sdf?" There is an issue related to this in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/12/dont-fail-silently-when-trying-to-load-a
